result.execSummary:
Brent L Blevins was extradited to another county, state or jurisdiction. Extradition means Brent L Blevins was accused or convicted of an offense in another county, state or jurisdiction and was taken there to face their charge(s) or conviction.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brent L Blevins

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Copy of Waiver of Extradition received and filed by Waukesha County Sheriff's Department.
Signed by Judge Lee S. Dreyfus, Jr., on 10/07/15.

Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Brent L Blevins in court, in custody.  
Extradition request from the State of Indiana (Grant County).
Defendant wants to waive extradition.
Defendant Signed Waiver of Extradition.

Court accepts and approves the defendant's waiver of extradition.
Court signs off on the waiver of extradition.
State of Indiana can be notified to pick up the defendant.
  Hearing scheduled for October 21, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Defendant to appear here or appear in Grant County, Indiana.

Defendant Brent L Blevins in court with attorney Eryn M Menden.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Attorney appears as friend of the court.  Hearing scheduled for October 7, 2015 at 09:00 am.
